title: Everyday English Course 93
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: He feels sorry for those students.
He thinks it right to punish those students.
He thinks those students should be expelled from college.
instances.correctAnswer: He thinks it right to punish those students.

variables.a: How does the man react to the woman's statement?

answerOptions: The woman should wait for another bus.
The woman shouldn't take a taxi.
The woman should take a taxi.
instances.correctAnswer: The woman should take a taxi.

variables.a: What does the man suggest?

answerOptions: The man found it easy to give up smoking.
The woman believed that the man could give up smoking.
The man couldn't give up smoking.
instances.correctAnswer: The man couldn't give up smoking.

variables.a: What can we learn from the conversation?

questionTemplates.text:
M: What do you think of this one?
W: It is really not my cup of tea. Too modern and unusual.
M: But look at the colors and forms. Very imaginative.
W: Maybe. I prefer a painting showing a view of the countryside.
{a}

answerOptions: This year's shuttle mission is a big step in space exploration.

instances.correctAnswer: The man is well informed about the space shuttle missions.
